adjectives.description: overage (comparative more overage, superlative most overage)

entries.meaning: Having an age that is greater than a stipulated minimum.
Too old to be of use in a particular situation.

verbs.description: overage (third-person singular simple present overages, present participle overaging, simple past and past participle overaged)

entries.meaning: To have too long an aging process.
A surplus of inventory or capacity or of cash that is greater than the amount in the record of an account.
A state of being more than one ought to be.
examples: You're entitled to bring a bag weighing fifty pounds onto the airplane, and will be charged extra for any overage.

entries.meaning: (property law) Any additional sums payable following the purchase of land, calculated on a prearranged basis, on the occurrence of certain specified events that are deemed to increase the value of that land; usually in the context of the development and further sale of that land.
